narrative.title: 164 Leichte Division - 1943Q1
narrative.situation: German Light Motorized Division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q1.
narrative.objectives: Light motorized division for defensive operations in Tunisia Campaign. Experienced desert warfare veterans adapted to defensive warfare in hilly terrain of southern Tunisia. Designed for mobile defense but mobility increasingly restricted by fuel shortages.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Southern Tunisia - Mareth Line sector. Rocky hills and wadis with occasional plains. Mareth Line fortifications originally built by French against Italian Libya. Natural defenses from hills and dry riverbeds (wadis). Coastal plain narrow with Matmata Hills inland. Terrain more varied than open desert of Egypt.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Desert and North African warfare experience (El Alamein, Retreat to Tunisia)
Defensive operations in prepared positions (Mareth Line fortifications)
Night operations to avoid Allied air superiority

environment.terrain_type: Southern Tunisia - Mareth Line sector. Rocky hills and wadis with occasional plains. Mareth Line fortifications originally built by French against Italian Libya. Natural defenses from hills and dry riverbeds (wadis). Coastal plain narrow with Matmata Hills inland. Terrain more varied than open desert of Egypt.
